evidence.source_document: Hampton Roads Regional Jail Final Monitoring Report
evidence.text: There were none that moved to a lower score this report period, even as HRRJ was closing.

This Agreement is structured to ensure that it terminates upon HRRJ’s showing that it has achieved durable compliance and the injuries caused by the alleged violations identified in the CRIPA Notice have been fully remedied.

extracted.value: Until durable compliance is achieved: Settlement agreement terminates upon HRRJ's showing of durable compliance

evidence.text: To meet the requirements of this Agreement and ensure that prisoners receive constitutionally adequate medical care, the Jail will increase medical staffing by hiring sufficient additional staff with appropriate credentials (e.g., MDs, RNs, and LPNs) and increasing the hours that current staff with higher credentials are onsite on evenings and weekends.

extracted.value: Increase medical staffing by hiring sufficient additional staff with appropriate credentials (e.g., MDs, RNs, and LPNs) and increasing the hours that current staff with higher credentials are onsite on evenings and weekends

evidence.text: Within six months of the Effective Date, the Jail will consult with the Monitor to draft and/or revise policies and procedures to incorporate and align them with the provisions in this Agreement.

extracted.value: Within six months of the Effective Date, the Jail will consult with the Monitor to draft and/or revise policies and procedures to incorporate and align them with the provisions in this Agreement

evidence.text: Within 30 days of the Effective Date, the Jail will ensure that prisoners expressing suicidality are provided access to clinically appropriate mental health care in suicide resistant housing with sight lines that permit the appropriate level of staff supervision.

evidence.text: This Agreement is enforceable only by the Parties. No person or entity is intended to be a third-party beneficiary of the provisions of this Agreement for purposes of any civil, criminal, or administrative action.
